DataElement.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Negation Discontinue Occurrence Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow clinical trial participation as outlined in the study protocol to address any activity that produces an effect or intended to alter the course of disease that cannot be stopped.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Negation Discontinue Occurrence Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._To stop or end, permanently or temporarily._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Property.preferredName: Negation Discontinue Occurrence Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has taken prescription or non-prescription drugs or other products known to be sensitive to CYP3A4 substrates or CYP3A4 substrates with a narrow therapeutic index, or to be moderate to strong inhibitors/inducers of CYP3A4 which cannot be discontinued 2 weeks prior to Day 1 of dosing and withheld throughout the study until 2 weeks after the last dose of study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has taken prescrip
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has taken prescription or non-prescription drugs or other products known to be sensitive to CYP3A4 substrates or CYP3A4 substrates with a narrow therapeutic index, or to be moderate to strong inhibitors/inducers of CYP3A4 can they cannot be discontinued 2 weeks prior to Day 1 of dosing and withheld throughout the study until 2 weeks after the last dose of study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has/had taken prescription or non-prescription drugs or other products known to be sensitive to CYP3A4 substrates or CYP3A4 substrates with a narrow therapeutic index, they cannot be discontinued 2 weeks prior to Day 1 of dosing and withheld throughout the study until 2 weeks after the last dose of study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has/had taken prescription or non-prescription drugs or other products known to be sensitive to CYP3A4 substrates or CYP3A4 substrates with a narrow therapeutic index, or to be moderate to strong inhibitors/inducers of CYP3A4, they cannot be discontinued 2 weeks prior to Day 1 of dosing and withheld throughout the study until 2 weeks after the last dose of study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient unable to discontinue prohibited medications or herbal preparations within 7 days of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue concomitant medications with sensitive substrates or narrow therapeutic index drugs of CYP3A4, P-gp BCRP, MATE1, and MATE2K, and strong inhibitors and inducers of CYP3A4?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any medications that are substrates of CYP3A4 with a narrow therapeutic window or strong inhibitors/inducers of CYP3A4 and they cannot be transferred to alternative medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving systemic steroid therapy that cannot be discontinued, with the exception of the use of prednisone or equivalent less than 0.125mg/kg/day as replacement therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue concomitant medications or herbal supplements that potentially interact with peposertib (M3814) (discontinue strong inducers/inhibitors of CYP3A4/5, CYP2C9, and CYP2C19 or substrates of CYP3A4/5, CYP1A2, and CYP2B6 with a narrow therapeutic index) prior to starting study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require concomitant therapy with potent inhibitors of CYP450 3A4 (e.g. ketoconazole, verapamil, etc.) or potent CYP3A4 inducers or with potent CYP450 1A2 inhibitors (fluoroquinolone antibiotics including ciprofloxacin, levofloxacin, and norfloxacin; ticlodipine, cimetidine, amiodarone, etc.) and cannot discontinue or change these medications prior to the start of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue concomitant medications or herbal supplements that are strong inhibitors or strong inducers of cytochrome P450 (CYP) isoenzymes CYP3A4/5, CYP2C9 and CYP2C19 during treatment with M3814 (discontinue inducers greater than or equal to 3 weeks or 5 elimination half-lives (whichever is shorter), discontinue inhibitors greater than or equal to 1 week or 5 elimination half-lives (whichever is shorter) or substrates of CYP1A2, CYP2B6 and CYP3A4/5 with narrow therapeutic index (discontinue greater than or equal to 1 day) prior to the first dose of M3814?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received strong inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A4, have they been discontinued less than 7 days prior to first dose of ZEN003694?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is receiving strong CYP3A4 inhibitors, is patient unable to discontinue them at least 1 week prior to starting irinotecan therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient requiring medications or substances that are strong inhibitors or strong inducers of CYP3A4 or CYP3A and strong inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A4 that cannot be discontinued at least 7 days prior to the first dose of ZEN003694 and abemaciclib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue medications or substances that are potent inhibitors, inducers or sensitive substrates of CYP3A4/5 or CYP2C19 prior to study treatment as follows: Medications or substances that are strong inhibitors of CYP3A4/5 or CYP2C19 must be discontinued at least 1 week prior to first M3814 dose.  Strong inducers of CYP3A4/5 or CYP2C19 must be stopped at least 3 weeks prior to the first dose.  Drugs mainly metabolized by CYP3A with a narrow therapeutic index (as judged by the Investigator or authorized designee) must be discontinued at least 1 day prior to first M3814 dose?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to avoid substrates of CYP1A2 with narrow therapeutic window while on ZEN003694?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue drugs that are strong inhibitors of CYP3A4 or CYP1A2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient needs to discontinue CYP3A4 inhibitors/inducers, can they be discontinued at least 5 times the half-life of the CYP3A4 inhibitors and 14 days of CYP3A4 inducers?
